2630340440
Problem: hello
Summary: Greet-em-all!
Weight: 100
Time limit: 0.5 second(s)
Memory limit: 32 MB
Test cases: 21
Description:
You have found an alien community. You wish to develop a friendly relationship with them. But they have put forth a clause. You have to wish their world hello as many times as they say. You are smart and decide to write a program to do that. Given the input N, you are to display Hello World that many times, one on each line. Be careful of the case sensitivity; lack of such basic discipline in communication tends to irritate the aliens.
Formatting/Constraints:
  • Input:
    1. A single integer N (0 <= N <= 10000).
  • Output:
    1. "Hello World" printed N times, once on each line (Quotes for clarity).
Examples:
  1. Input: 
    5
    Output: 
    Hello World
Hello World
Hello World
Hello World
Hello World
    Analysis:
    Pretty obvious, isn't it?
